observations.Description of Observation:
Multiple things froze causing us issues. Obviously I would suggest starting and running the engines from the yard and not turning them off until Thursday when the weather gets better.

One less obvious problem we had was the way the hose was hung up vertically, it held water inside after being washed I assume which created a solid piece of ice. We didn’t realize this and rigged it up, we were unable to use it to pump thru for the first joint.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: We tried multiple different ways to defrost it.

Sse was closing hyc elevators, I had already explained the risks, if you don’t latch the elevators, the joint may come out of the track, so before you signal the driller to come up you must check to see if the joint is still in the skate.
I was working the mud hose, he signalled the driller up, I noticed he didn’t look, I quickly grabbed the box as the driller came up and signalled him to stop. I held the joint while he latched it.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation:
Rig personnel used the top drive to lift the BOP and the forklift for stability. Moving the BOP in order to remove the spool from the bottom and replace it with the wellhead. Requiring personnel to be in the immediate area entirely reliant on the chains used. 

My suggestion would be to use a pole truck in the future to minimize potential risks involved with the movement of the BOP and personnel that need to be around during certain portions of the task.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation: While removing the spool from the bottom of the BOP in order to add the wellhead. This was done with pre-discussed thought out actions to make it the safest possible.  Communication and awareness during the task were on point.

observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: The pusher was notified and the bolt was tightened and a keeper pit into place.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Name: Andrew Pina
observations.Description of Observation: While Andrew was operating the forklift another employee was positioned behind the forklift as Andrew needed to move backward.  Andrew speed the forklift and honked to get his coworkers attention and had him move away from the forklift buffer zone.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Name: Marcelino Rodriguez
observations.Description of Observation: Marcelino stopped the forklift from backing up when a water truck was passing behind him.  This was a great catch.  Forklift operator was them coached regarding awareness.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation: Changed out water in portable eyewash station before cold snap next week. To keep water from freezing up and busting portable eyewash station before cold.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: Changed water in portable eyewash stations

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Name: Jason Scarborough
observations.Description of Observation: When the cement crew was fully rigged up Transcend crew began prepping the rig to be skidded once cementing is done.  Jason hooked up the chains onto the rig floor steps and left the chain on the stairs. Thus presenting an immediate hazard.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: Jason was stopped and the trip/ fall hazard was pointed out. Chains were removed from the walkway immediately by Jason.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Name: Jordan Brodbeck
observations.Description of Observation: Jordan conducted a safety meeting that superseded expectations. Jordan thoroughly went over all topics accordingly and recognized and followed ExxonMobil's PSMS standards.

observations.Name: Carlos DeLaGarza
observations.Description of Observation: Hand was going down the stairs when his glove caught a burr and tore his glove
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: Motor man took a file a grinder burr all the way down

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation: Group of unused generator cables laying in the walkway bringing a potential for trips & falls.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: Pusher and driller were notified and the cable was picked up and stowed accordingly.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation: When they started working on the shaker motor #1. They had all paperwork and were locked out in accordance to TRANSCEND DRILLING LOTO procedures.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc

observations.Location / Task: BEU 33 QR Pad C/ Rig Move
observations.Description of Observation: After our safety meeting where we covered the importance of checking our loads before a rig move making sure our landing gears were up, a trucker drove off location without raising landing gear cracking it in three places.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: We alerted the trucker to stop what he was doing so we could resolve the situation.

observations.Company: Transcend Drilling Company Inc
observations.Description of Observation: Third party truck driver delivering casing was maneuvering through location at an excessive speed.  During the time the rig was being rigged up with multiple employees on the ground.
observations.What Action / Correction was Taken?: The driver was stopped and spoken with about his speed on Transcend/ Devon location.
